member.name: M:Catharsis.Commons.ConvertExtensions.Boolean(Catharsis.Commons.Convert,System.Object)

summary.para: Converts target object to the value, using non-strict approach.

The following algorithm is used to determine how to perform such conversion:
If is a null reference, the result is false.
If is a value, it's returned as it is.
If is a positive numeric value, the result is true, if it's negative or zero - the result is false.
If is a , true is returned if it contains at least one character, false otherwise.
If implements , true is returned if it contains at least one element, false otherwise.
If is a value, true is returned if it's not empty, false otherwise.
If is a value, true is returned if it's successful, false otherwise.

member.param: Extended converter instance.
Target object for conversion.
member.returns: instance that was converted to .

member.name: M:Catharsis.Commons.ObjectExtensions.Equality``1(``0,``0,System.String[])

summary.para: Determines whether specified objects are considered equal by comparing values of the given set of properties/fields on each of them.

The following algorithm is used in equality determination:
If both and are null references, method returns true.
If one of compared objects is null and another is not, method returns false.
If both objects references are equal (they represent the same object instance), method returns true.
If set is either a null reference or contains zero elements, attribute is used for equality comparison.
If type does not contain any properties/fields in set, method is used for equality comparison.
If type contains any of the properties/fields in set, their values are used for equality comparison according to method of both and instances.

member.param: Current object to compare with the second.
Second object to compare with the current one.
Set of properties/fields whose values are used in equality comparison.
member.returns: true if and are considered equal, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Catharsis.Commons.ObjectExtensions.Equality``1(``0,``0,System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{``0,System.Object}}[])

summary.para: Determines whether specified objects are considered equal by comparing values of the given set of properties, represented as expression trees, on each of them.

The following algorithm is used in equality determination:
If both and are null references, method returns true.
If one of compared objects is null and another is not, method returns false.
If both objects references are equal (they represent the same object instance), method returns true.
If set is either a null reference or contains zero elements, attribute is used for equality comparison.
If type does not contain any properties in set, method is used for equality comparison.
If type contains any of the properties in set, their values are used for equality comparison according to method of both and instances.

member.param: Current object to compare with the second.
Second object to compare with the current one.
Set of properties in a form of expression trees, whose values are used in equality comparison.
member.returns: true if and are considered equal, false otherwise.

If is a null reference, methods returns 0.

member.param: Target object, whose hash code is to be returned.
Collection of properties names, whose values are to be used in hash code's calculation.
member.returns: Hash code for .
